definitions.definition: A reduction in cost or expenditure.
definitions.example: The shift of the supplier gave us a saving of 10 percent.

definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) Something (usually money) that is saved, particularly money that has been set aside for the future.
definitions.example: I invested all my savings in gold.

definitions.definition: The action of the verb to save.
That saves someone from damnation; redemptive.
Bringing back in returns or in receipts the sum expended; incurring no loss, though not gainful.
definitions.example: The ship has made a saving voyage.

definitions.definition: (in compound adjectives) relating to making a saving: e.g. labour-saving, energy-saving light bulbs.
With the exception of; except; save.
